content: We're noticing that some of the output files, .cql and Elm .json files now have version numbers in their names. Is that something that changed with Sushi 2.0? Is there a way to turn this off in the config file?

I don't think SUSHI has anything to do with that, but I must admit I am a little confused by the question since SUSHI does not produce CQL or ELM files. If you run SUSHI then look at input/fsh-generated you'll see exactly what SUSHI produces and which filenames it uses. It might be that the IG Publisher is doing something different now?
@John Silva , where are you seeing this? We do have a versioned option in the CQF Tooling, but the IG Publisher itself doesn't do this.

Bryn,
I think this might have been a 'false alarm' --- we had some files
(.cql) with version numbers in their name and then the elm generated
file would contain the same basename (with version number) in it and our
wrapper script wasn't expecting this. I think someone on our team fixed
this by renaming the .cql files.

Thanks,
John
